title: No columna in message list 147.0.2
creator: Creid
content:
I just got a new Windows 11 computer. After installing Thunderbird 147.0.2 I noticed there were no columns at the top of the message pane as there had been in the past. I read articles about how to add the columns but could not find the column icon or anything in the header area that allowed me to do what the articles recommended.

I want to add the columns for sorting purposes from time to time but I can't find a way to do it. HELP!!! Please?

Thanks, Clyde

title: Ordner "verschwunden"
creator: helmut.koecher
content: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, seit vielen Jahren benutze ich Thunderbird für meinen Mailverkehr – zur Zeit mit der Version 147.1. Beim Posteingang habe ich den Ordner <TU> mit vielen Unterordnern zum Abspeichern wichtiger Informationen eingerichtet. Seit einigen Tagen ist dieser Ordner „verschwunden“ - lässt sich nicht mehr abrufen. Bei der Benutzung von <OutlookWeb> mittels msx@tu-dresden.de ist dieser Ordner wie gewohnt vorhanden. Nach geöffnetem Profilordner habe ich die Datei <global-messages-db.sqlite> gefunden, Thunderbird geschlossen und diese Datei gelöscht. Nach wie vor fehlt jedoch bei Neuöffnung von Thunderbird beim Posteingang der Ordner <TU> mit den vielen Unterordnern. Es wäre durchaus möglich, dass dieser Ordner <TU> eine Größe von mehr als 2 GB mit seinen vielen Unterordnern besitzt ? Inzwischen habe ich beim Posteingang eigentlich parallel zu <TU> einen neuen Ordner <XXX> angelegt, der auch angezeigt bleibt. Bestimmt lässt sich dies bei Thunderbird mit einigen Klicks wieder aktivieren. Für Ihre Hilfe möchte ich Ihnen im Voraus danken. Mit freundlichen Grüßen H. Köcher
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/145.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;tb_version:147.1;os:Windows 11;solver_id:7418133

title: Unable to Log In to Onet Email Account in Thunderbird
creator: konrad.fedec
content:
Dear Support Team,

I am experiencing problems logging in to my Onet email account. The issue occurs when I try to access my mailbox, particularly through Mozilla Thunderbird.

Could you please let me know what might be causing this issue? Is there any specific configuration required in my Onet account settings before logging in?

Additionally, do I need to reconfigure any settings in Thunderbird (such as incoming/outgoing server settings, ports, SSL/TLS, or authentication method) to ensure successful login?

I would also like to mention that I do not experience any login issues when using email accounts from Wirtualna Polska (WP/O2) or Gmail in Thunderbird. The problem seems to occur only with my Onet account.

Please let me know if you need any additional details from my side. I would appreciate your guidance on how to resolve this issue as soon as possible.

Kind regards, Konrad
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Windows 11

title: Sending messages from Thunderbird via Outlook server results in error
creator: bob.fannon
content:
bob.fannon

Feb 14, 2026, 13:01 CST

I have used Thunderbird for a number of years with Plusnet (using POP settings) in the UK. However, Plusnet has transferred their support to a company called Greenby who have made a hash of it and offer very poor support. So, I want to use Outlook as the mail server but I am unable to send any messages via Thunderbird to the Outlook server. I can however download messages with no problems. The error message I get is :- Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'

My default Outgoing Sever settings are :- Server Name : smtp.office365.com Port: 587 User Name: bob.fannon@outlook.com Authentication method: OAuth2 Connection Security: STARTTLS

I have tried deleting the Thunderbird account and re-creating it but still got the same result. I also tried to use my old Icloud account ( having first setup my App Specific password) but got the same result.

title: How do we make left column show everything below last Account name?
creator: redacted
content:
Preamble:

  1. There are 34 email Accounts listed in left column.
  2. (Image 1) When in "Mail" column I can see down to only the Account Name (address). There is only the Account Name and Inbox.. nothing else below that can be seen - no Drafts, Sent, Archives, Spam, or Deleted. Anything below is missing too.
  3. When choosing "Account Setting", everything for last account shows up, plus Outgoing, Add-ons (Image 2). Too, we can see the Offline/Online Icon.

QUESTION: How may I fix it so that the last account shows all sub-sections of the account - i.e., Server Settings, Copies & Folders etcetera right on down to Online/Offline or at best, down to "Return Receipts" for the last account?

Thanks for volunteering, ~r
